data.title: Ave.ai officially launches on-chain perpetual contract functionality.
data.description: On October 31st, according to official news, multi-chain aggregation trading platform Ave.ai announced its official integration with edgeX's PerpDEX system, launching a new on-chain perpetual contract trading function. This function is already available in the latest version of the Ave.ai Android app, with iOS and web versions to be supported in subsequent versions. This upgrade marks Ave.ai's transition from a multi-chain aggregation spot platform to a stage of "integrated spot + contract trading, 100% on-chain execution." Through deep integration with edgeX, the platform achieves low-latency matching, high security, and efficient cross-chain interaction under a decentralized architecture, further enhancing the on-chain trading experience and market liquidity. Key features include on-chain matching and settlement mechanisms based on edgeX PerpDEX, deeper multi-chain liquidity aggregation, fully decentralized execution, and AI-driven transaction analysis support. Ave.ai stated that this expansion is a significant milestone in building its full-chain trading infrastructure, and it will continue to integrate smart contracts and cross-chain data analysis to create a more complete decentralized trading ecosystem.

data.title: Binance Market Update (2025-10-31)
data.description:
The global cryptocurrency market cap now stands at $3.73T, down by -1.85% over the last day, according to CoinMarketCap data.

Bitcoin (BTC) has been trading between $106,304 and $110,531 over the past 24 hours. As of 09:30 AM (UTC) today, BTC is trading at $110,005, down by -0.39%.

data.title: Radiant Capital Hacker Transfers Over 5,400 ETH to Tornado Cash
data.description: According to Odaily, PeckShield has reported that a hacker associated with Radiant Capital has transferred 5,411.8 ETH into Tornado Cash. The value of this transaction is approximately $20.7 million.

data.title: A New York court granted Multichain's liquidators' request to extend the freeze on the stolen USDC addresses.
data.description: A New York court has granted a request for interim relief from Circle, the Singapore-based liquidator representing the Multichain Foundation, ordering the company to continue freezing three wallet addresses involved in the hacking attack until further notice. This measure will prevent the transfer of USDC from these wallets. According to court documents, Circle implemented the freeze by adding the relevant addresses to a blacklist mechanism within the USDC smart contract. Multichain suffered a $210 million cross-chain bridge attack in July 2023, which included the theft of approximately $63 million in USDC. Earlier this year, Multichain entered liquidation proceedings in Singapore to recover the stolen assets. The court believes this interim relief is an effective mechanism for maintaining asset security in cross-border bankruptcy cases and helps promote judicial cooperation between the US and foreign courts. Previously, the US Department of Justice had requested Circle to freeze the addresses involved but withdrew the seizure order due to its inability to confirm the hacker's identity. Separately, a group of US investors have filed a class-action lawsuit against Circle regarding the same batch of stolen USDC, and both parties have agreed to maintain the account freeze during the litigation process. (The Block)

data.title: Aster will launch spot and futures trading for Nubila (NB), with over 6 million NB tokens and a $200,000 reward pool.
data.description: According to official news, the trading volume of the first phase of Aster Rocket Launch has exceeded $1 billion, and Nubila (NB) will be the next project to be listed. Aster will simultaneously list Nubila (NB) on both the spot and perpetual futures markets. Spot trading will open on October 31, 2025 at 20:00 (UTC+8), and perpetual contract trading will start at 21:00 (UTC+8). This Rocket Launch will distribute a total of $200,000 worth of ASTER rewards and over 6 million NB tokens, distributed through separate spot and perpetual contract reward pools. Both NB spot and perpetual trading pairs will enjoy a 1.2x token bonus incentive.

data.title: Venezuela Develops System to Integrate Blockchain with Traditional Banking
data.description: According to Foresight News, Venezuela is in the process of developing a system to connect traditional banking with blockchain technology. Conexus, a company that manages 40% of Venezuela's electronic transfer systems, is in the early stages of creating a platform aimed at integrating stablecoins and Bitcoin into the country's banking network. Once completed, this system will enable Venezuelan banks to offer custody and transfer services for these digital assets, as well as exchange services with fiat currency. While the launch date for the platform has not been finalized, analysts suggest it could be operational as early as December.

data.title: On-Chain Revenue Report Highlights Growth in Crypto Market
data.description: According to PANews, 1kx has released its most comprehensive report on the crypto market's on-chain revenue to date, titled '1kx On-Chain Revenue Report (First Half of 2025).' The report compiles verified on-chain fee data from over 1,200 protocols, illustrating user payment paths, value flows, and key growth drivers.The significance of on-chain fees lies in their role as a direct indicator of genuine payment demand. The report contrasts the open, global, and investment-worthy nature of the on-chain ecosystem with the restricted and mature off-chain ecosystem. Data comparisons reveal a 126% year-over-year increase in on-chain application fees, compared to a mere 15% growth off-chain.In 2020, on-chain activities were experimental, but by 2025, they have evolved into a $20 billion measurable economy. Users pay for hundreds of application scenarios, including trading, buying and selling, data storage, and cross-application collaboration. This year, 1,124 protocols have achieved on-chain profitability.DeFi remains a core pillar, contributing 63% of total fees, though the industry landscape is rapidly changing. Wallet services have surged by 260%, transforming interfaces into profit centers. Consumer applications have grown by 200%, directly monetizing user traffic. DePIN has skyrocketed by 400%, bringing computing power and connectivity services on-chain.Despite total fees not surpassing the 2021 peak, the ecosystem's health is stronger than ever. At that time, ETH on-chain fees accounted for over 40%, but transaction costs have since decreased by 86%. The number of profitable protocols has increased eightfold, and token holder dividends have reached record highs.Asset prices determine on-chain fees in USD, aligning with expectations but requiring attention to price volatility and seasonal cycles. Since 2021, application fees and valuations have shown a strong causal relationship, with fees driving up valuations. Specific on-chain factors significantly impact certain sectors.The top 20 protocols account for 70% of total fees, but rankings frequently change due to the crypto industry's rapid disruption. The top five protocols are Meteora, Jito, Jupiter, Raydium, and Solana. Despite application projects dominating fee generation, their market share remains unchanged. This is because the valuation logic for application projects mirrors traditional enterprises, with DeFi price-to-earnings ratios around 17 times, while public chain valuations reach 3,900 times, reflecting additional narrative value.Looking ahead, baseline forecasts indicate that on-chain fees will exceed $32 billion by 2026, a 63% increase driven mainly by the application layer. RWA, DePIN, wallets, and consumer applications are entering a period of accelerated growth. As scaling technologies advance, L1 fees are expected to stabilize. With favorable regulatory developments, this marks the beginning of the crypto industry's maturity, where application scale, fee income, and value distribution will progress in tandem.

data.title: The EU’s two-tier encryption vision is digital feudalism
data.description:
EU's ProtectEU mandates on-device scanning before encryption, creating a two-tier security system where states encrypt while citizens are surveilled. Digital feudalism codified.
source: https://cointelegraph.com/news/eu-encryption-digital-feudalism?utm_source=rss_feed&utm_medium=rss&utm_campaign=rss_partner_inbound
